ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great class! Discussion of important nonparametric topics.
A combination of theory and practice ,very helpful.
It is a very good course; the instructor is fantastic

This course is very good in the way that there are a small number of students so everyone can get a chance to ask questions and get the instructor's attention immediately and get the answer. The instructor is very clear in explaining the details of the course and very patient. The TA is very helpful.

This course covers many essential topics in nonparametric analysis. The methods are novel and helpful to me. The examples are really helpful to understand how the methods work so more examples the better.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Heping Zhang  Very good! Great at explaining topics.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Professor Zhang is very helpful, and he is always willing to answer questions. In addition, his slides are clear.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  The instructor has extensive knowledge in the course. He is one of the best in the school.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  He is very good in trying to explaining and answering students' questions.
Instructor: Heping Zhang  Dr. Zhang taught the course in a clear and straightforward way. Very patient with the questions in class.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is a very good for anyone who wants to understand theoretical machine learning.
It is worthwhile to take if you want to learn more about non-parametric methods in data analysis and it has covered something in machine learning too.
Great course to learn about nonparametric analysis. The contents are adequate and workload is appropriate.
